summary: The documents highlight various aspects of compensation related to individuals working with or for the CIA and the House Select Committee on Assassinations. These include contract amendments detailing adjustments to compensation and allowances for individuals like Edward G. Tichborn, George Martin Rosnek, and Bruce A. Bertotally. A payroll certification lists employees of the Select Committee on Assassinations, their positions, salaries, and gross pay. One document also refers to a salary raise for Subject 201-332676, necessitating an amended Memorandum of Oral Commitment (MOC). The documents collectively illustrate the financial aspects of engaging personnel for intelligence and investigative activities during the relevant period.
significance: In the context of the JFK assassination, compensation details can provide insights into the resources allocated to investigations and operations, as well as the individuals involved and their roles. Payroll records and contract details may reveal connections between individuals and organizations, potentially shedding light on the scope and nature of related activities.
